metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9964 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
redirect() in bottle.py in bottle 0.12.10 doesn't filter a "\r\n" sequence, which leads to a CRLF attack, as demonstrated by a redirect("233\r\nSet-Cookie: name=salt") call. It was discovered that Bottle improperly handles headers. An attacker could possibly exploit this as a CRLF attack.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9964` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-bottle - 0.12.0-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
python3-bottle - 0.12.0-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python-bottle package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.12.0-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
